lines.text: Sometimes you gotta say "What the Fuck", make your move. Joel, every now and then, saying "What the Fuck", brings freedom. Freedom brings opportunity, opportunity makes your future. So your parents are going out of town. You got the place all to yourself.
Yeah.
What the fuck.
[last lines]
My name is Joel Goodson. I deal in human fulfillment. I grossed over eight thousand dollars in one night. Time of your life, huh kid?
I don't believe this! I've got a trig midterm tomorrow, and I'm being chased by Guido the killer pimp.
Porsche. There is no substitute.
Fuck you.
Say "what the fuck."... If you can't say it, you can't do it.
You know, Bill, there's one thing I learned in all my years. Sometimes you just gotta say, "What the fuck, make your move."
I beg your pardon?
Some of the girls are wearing my mother's clothing.
What's wrong with that?
I just don't want to spend the rest of my life in analysis.
Sometimes you just gotta say "what the heck."
It was great the way her mind worked. No guilt, no doubts, no fear. None of my specialities. Just the shameless pursuit of immediate gratification. What a capitalist.
It seems to me that if there were any logic to our language, trust would be a four letter word.
Who's the U-Boat Commander?
Looks like the University of Illinois!
[first lines]

"You want me to go?" "No," she says; "I want you to wash my back." So now, I'm gettin' enthusiastic about this dream. So I go to her, but she's hard to find through all the steam and stuff; I keep losing her. Finally I get to the door... and I... find myself in a room full of kids taking their college boards. I'm over three hours late; I've got two minutes to take the whole test. I've... just made a terrible mistake. I'll never get to college. My life is ruined.

[Miles tries to comfort Joel after the Porsche incident]
You okay? Do you want an aspirin? Your dad own a gun?
[Miles is taunting Joel with outrageous personal ads]
"When I was a little girl, my daddy used to spank my bare bottom. Now he's gone. Will you take his place?" Call Misty!
Please Joel, do what they say, just get off the babysitter.
So is this Guido guy... he's your "manager"?
That's right.
Or a pimp?
Now that's quick Joel. Have you always been this quick, or is this something new?
You didn't tell anyone did ya?
No... Glen knows.
What about Barry?
He knows too.
Okay. Just don't tell anyone.

[to Joel]
What happened?
Last night?
That's right - with Kessler.
She was babysitting down the street...
We know that!
So I went over there. It turns out that, uh, she was giving the kid a bath and accidentally hit the shower thing...
[some guy off camera]
right.
That could happen.
...and all her clothes were drying upstairs. So she plops down right on the kitchen floor and she looks up at me and says 'I think I'm in the mood.'
She said that? What did you say?
I didn't have to say anything.
Whatcha do?
What do you think I did?
I think you got the hell out of there, ran home, and wacked off.
[makes a wacking off noise with his cheek]
I disagree.
[to Joel]
Did you have your bike there?
Yeah.
I think you jumped on your bike, peddled home, and wacked off!
Don't steal anything. If I come back here and anything's missing, I'm going straight to the police. I mean it.
Joel, go to school. Go learn something.
[Joel Goodson's parents are away for the weekend]
Joel, you wanna know something? Every now and then say, "What the fuck." "What the fuck" gives you freedom. Freedom brings opportunity. Opportunity makes your future.
Shithead!
When it came right down to it, I just wasn't attracted to her.
That should never stop you.
[On calling Lana]
It's what you want. It's what every white boy off the lake wants.
College women can smell ignorance... like dog shit.
[Lana is the prostitute Joel has hired using an alias]
Are you ready for me... Ralph?
[after Joel's Princeton interview]
So, how're we doin'?
Looks like University of Illinois!
Uh, my name isn't really Ralph. It's Joel.
Mmmm. I'll be needing 300 bucks... *Joel*.
You're kidding.
No, I don't believe that I am.
Well, uh, it's just that I don't have that much here in the house.
How much do you have?
I have 50 dollars.
50 dollars? What are we going to do about this, Joel?
I don't know.
[pauses]
Could I send it to you?

[incredulous]
Could you *send* it to me?

[long pause]
I, uh, have a bond at the bank. I could go cash that.
I'm not real good at waiting.
I'll be quick.

Let me give you a little advice so you know. In times of economic uncertainty, never ever fuck with another man's livelihood. Go have fun, now? You know fun, time of your life? Maybe if you follow that, I won't have to come back here.
Listen to me.
No, no. You listen to ME!
[Guido hangs up]
Shit!
You listen to me, buster. You, you a-hole.
A-hole?
I want my stuff back right now.

Now you listen to me, you little fuck. Not only you take my two best girls, you call me names. If I didn't have any self-respect, it wouldn't just be the furniture, it'd be your arms, your legs, your head.
I don't think I am going to say, "What the fuck?" anymore
You've done a lot of solid work here, but it's just not Ivy League, now is it?
Hello, Joel. I'm Jackie.
Hello, Jackie. I'm not Joel. Joel stepped out for a moment. Hold on... I'll go call him.
What if I said I'd be your girlfriend the next couple of days? No charge.
I'm really trying to be, friends with you. But, I'd appreciate it, if you'd stop laying these little judgments on me, while you're leaning on your daddy's $40,000 car.
